content.description: Follow the crack up the boulder, the crux comes towards the top. I would advise people to use cation this rock is DG (decomposing granite) holds can and will break.
content.location: This boulder is part of what I have been calling shepherds west, it is located off of crowley lake drive. park at rainbow tarns road and walk down the dirt road headed west (away from toms place) towards aspen springs. after about 10 minutes you will arrive at the main boulder, once there you will find the boulder about 50 feet away.

content.description: follow the well defined chimney up the corner of the boulder, crux comes at the top. I advise caution with this boulder as it composed of DG (decomposing granite) holds can and will break.
content.location: Shepards West, park at rainbow tarns road just north of toms place off of crowley lake drive. follow the dirt road headed towards aspen springs for about 10 mins where you will arrive at shepards west main boulder, boulder will be found about 50 feet away.

content.description: Start left in the crack, follow up and across into the Sloppy Joe's chimney, then continue on up. crux comes at the top.I advise caution with this boulder as it composed of DG (decomposing granite) holds can and will break.
content.location: Located in Shepard's West, park at rainbow tarns road just off of crowley lake drive just north of toms place. follow the dirt road towards aspen springs for about 10 mins, you will arrive at the main boulder of Shepard's West, this boulder will be found 50 feet away.

content.description: Crux comes midway. Highball on great rock.
content.location: Arete that faces 395 on the main boulder.
